intro: Senecio pulicarioides var. pulicarioides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers arranged in a spherical shape, which bloom from late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often have a bluish-gray hue due to a dense covering of fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
